Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau [rice cooked in a seasoned broth with vegetables or meat] and dolma [stuffed vegetables]. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch.

Salman sells his crop from his yard and sometimes takes them to the local bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN. He would like to purchase more seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality of his crops, increase his sales, and expand his business. For this purpose he applied for 1,900 AZN. This will be his second loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Janeth Del Rocio

texts.es: Janeth tiene 26 años estado civil casada tiene 1 hijo de 6 años que va a una escuela pública  de Guayaquil desde que dio a luz a su hijo ella tuvo que ver también la forma de llevar ingreso a su hogar ya que el sueldo de esposo no les alcanza para sustentar los gastos de su hijo, la llevo a tomar el rumbo de vender cosmético y vio que si era productiva pues en la actualidad ese es su fuente de trabajo. Y así Janeth ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la casa: Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar: perfumes , cremas corporal, lociones, maquillaje, etc.
texts.en:
Janeth, 26, is married and has 6 year old son who attends a public school in Guayaquil. After giving birth to her son, Janeth needed to find a way to earn an income as her husband's salary was not enough to cover the household expenses. This led her on the path of selling cosmetics to see if it was productive, and she still has her business today. 

Janeth is able to help her husband with their household expenses, and with the loan she intends to purchase perfumes, body creams, lotions, makeup, etc.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, body creams, lotions, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Mariza Alexandra

texts.es: Mariza tiene 37 años de edad estado civil casada tiene 2 hijos. Su esposo es chofer. Ella empezó el negocio de ser comerciante por influencia de sus amigas ya que ella vio que sus amigas tenían este negocio y le iba muy bien pues ella quiso tomar los mismos pasos y ser comerciante de ropa, pues ese es su trabajo en la actualidad con la ayuda del préstamo del banco D-MIRO, Ella comprara pantalones, almohada, blusas, shorts etc.
texts.en: Mariza, 37, is married with two children and her husband is a driver.  She started her sales business because of encouragement from friends who had similar businesses that were successful.  So she wanted to get involved selling clothing and that is how she earns a living.  She will use the loan she is requesting through D-MIRO to buy pants, pillows, blouses, shorts, etc.

loans.use: To buy pants, pillows, blouses, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Italia Cruz

texts.es: Italia tiene 48 años de edad estado civil casada tiene 1 hijo que estudia en un colegio público  de Guayaquil. Italia tiene 1 kiosco de venta de colas, snack, golosinas, El esposo de Italia es carpintero y cuando no tiene trabajo la ayuda con el kiosco , Ella trabaja en el kiosco todas las mañana de lunes a viernes porque, ella los fines de semana es enfermera .Su sueño es tener un gran local de víveres. Con el préstamo Italia quiere comprar: colas, yogurts, papitas, etc.
texts.en:
Italia, 48, is married and has a son who goes to the public school in Guayaquil.  She has a kiosk where she sells sodas, snacks and sweets.  Italia's husband is a carpenter and when he runs out of work he helps out at the kiosk.

She works at the kiosk in the morning, Monday through Friday, because on weekends she works as a nurse.  Her goal is to have a large grocery store.  Italia plans to use the loan to buy sodas, yoghurts, potato chips, etc.

loans.use: To buy sodas, yoghurts, potato chips, etc.

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es:
José tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos.  Desde que tenia 10 años de edad, ha trabajado en la agricultura, luego empezó a trabajar en la albañilería, que es de donde obtiene los ingresos para sostener a su familia. Es una familia unida tienen buena reputación en la comunidad, con valores y principios, él se siente feliz con su esposa y sus dos hijos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos sacos de abono, dos arrobas de formula, fungicidas, insecticidas, foliares, pago de mano de obra y el resto del dinero lo utilizara para cancelar el saldo pendiente de un crédito. Con la inversión podrá sembrar el maíz que tanto necesita para el sustento de su familia, y se ahorra porque ya no tendrá que comprarlo. Sus objetivos, son construir su casa de adobe, teja, polines, instalar una granja de cerdos,  pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras; y continuar trabajando con la fundación campo para cumplir todos sus objetivos.
texts.en:
José, 27, is married and has two children.  Since he was ten years old he has been working in agriculture, although he later started working as a bricklayer to make enough income to support the family.  It is a close-knit family that has a good reputation in the community because of its values and principles.  He is happy with his wife and two children.

The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy two sacks of fertilizer, formula, fungicides, insecticides, weed killer and hire workers.  The rest of the money will be used to pay off a loan.  With this investment he will be able to plant corn which he needs to feed the family.  He will be able to save by not having to buy it.  His goal is to build a house out of adobe, tiles, and poles.  He also wants to set up a pig farm and raise chickens.  He intends on continuing to work with the Fundación Campo to meet his goals.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer, formula, fungicides, insecticides, weedkillers, and hire workers.  The rest of the money will be used to pay off a loan.

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 64 años de edad.  Desde que tenía 10 años de edad, empezó a trabajar en las fincas de café, a la edad de 30 años ingreso como socia de la Cooperativa de café durante 10 años, hoy en día recibe una pensión por haber trabajado ahí. Tiene una hija que le ayuda económicamente y que trabaja en las fincas de café. Ella es una persona trabajadora con buena reputación en la comunidad, con valores y principios, es cliente recurrente en la Fundación. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 2000 tejas, 3 bolsas de cemento, un flete de cuartones de madera y pago de mano de obra. Ella con la inversión lo que busca es mejorar su casa, para que ya no se filtre el agua y su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones. Ella desea trabajar en las milpas, frijoleras, instalar una granja de pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras y continuar mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 64, began working on coffee plantations when she was ten years old.  At age 30 she became a member of the coffee co-op for ten years and now she receives a pension for having worked there.  She has a daughter who helps her economically and works on the coffee plantations.  

María is a hard worker who has a very good reputation in the community, with her values and principles.  She is a returning customer of the Fundación.

The loan she is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy 2,000 tiles, 3 bags of cement, wooden scantlings and hire workers.  The aim of her investment is to renovate her house because of the water leakage and to give her family better living conditions.  She wants to start growing corn and beans and set up a chicken farm, as well as continue improving her home.

loans.use: To buy 2,000 tiles, 3 bags of cement, wooden scantlings and hire workers.

loans.name: Ninoska

texts.es: Ninoska es una joven, bastante emprendedora es muy dedicada a su trabajo y también a su hogar. Sus padres  hace varios años contrajeron una deuda para  la compra de su vivienda, pero hace 3 años que la madre de Ninoska sufrió una embolia, por lo que todos los ingresos de su Padre se tuvieron que invertir en la salud de su mamá, por tal motivo hicieron un traspaso de la deuda a nombre de Ninoska y actualmente ella se hace cargo de esta deuda. Ella desenvuelve su actividad laboral, realizando tramites legales, transferencia de nombre en títulos de propiedad, realiza gravamen en el transito e hipoteca de bien inmuebles en derechos reales, y todo lo relacionado a tramites legales, es estudiante de  la carrera de Derecho, lo cual también le dio el conocimiento para realizar algunos de estos trámites, sin embargo ella dice que en el trabajo  es donde mas esta aprendiendo sobre estos tramites y sobre acciones legales. Lamentablemente su señora madre continua delicada de salud, los médicos aconsejaron que viva en un lugar como Cochabamba pues tiene problemas con la presión arterial y en La Paz la altura le perjudica aun mas, Ninoska viaja a esa ciudad casi todos los fines de semana con el fin de ver a su madre y además de contribuir con algunos gastos para la mantención de la misma.
texts.en:
Ninoska is a young woman who is quite the entrepreneur and very dedicated to her work and household.  Several years ago her parents went into debt when they purchased their home and three years ago Ninoska's mother had a stroke.   Therefore all of her father's income has been used to care for her mother, and the debt was put into Ninoska's name so she is now covering payment.

Her work consists of handling legal transactions, transfer of property titles, transit and mortgage tax services and everything related to legal paperwork.  She is studying law which has given her the knowledge she needs to do her work, but says where she learns more through hands-on transactions and legal action.  Unfortunately, her mother is still ill and the doctors have recommended that she live somewhere such as Cochabamba.  She has blood pressure problems and the altitude of La Paz makes them worse.  Ninoska travels on weekends to see her mother and help out with related expenses.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Исматулло 30 - летний женатый мужчина, проживающий в районе Хамадони. Он живет с родителями. Исматулло зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Животноводством он занимается четыре года. Исматулло берет кредит для закупа коров и телят.
texts.en: Ismatullo is 30 years old, married and lives in the Hamadoni region with his parents.  He raises large livestock and has been involved in animal husbandry for four years.  Ismatullo is asking for a loan to buy cows and calves.

loans.use: to buy cows and calves.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо жительница района Хамадони. Она замужем. Ей 47 лет. Зулайхо зарабатывает путем разведения крупного рогатого скота. Она в основном разводит скот у себя дома. В этой области она четыре года. Зулайхо берет кредит для закупа бычков и телят.
texts.en: Zulaykho lives in the Hamadoni region.  She is 47 years old and is married.  She raises large livestock, mainly on her own farm, and has been involved in animal husbandry for four years.  Zulaykho is asking for a loan to buy bulls and calves.

loans.use: to buy bulls and calves.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 50 лет. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она планирует организовать свой бизнес для обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота. Ее старшие дети будут помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Karomat is a very hard-working woman.  She is 50 years old and a widow with four children in her care.  She plans to start her own business to help provide for her family's needs.  With this goal in mind, she took the "Bring It On" course organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Now she is fully capable of starting her business and becoming successful in that area.  She wants to start a business buying and selling livestock.  Her elder children can help her run this business.  She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy her livestock so she can start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Ранее полученный кредит был использован для приобретения муки. Гуландом купила муку. Сейчас торговлей вместо нее занимается ее сын. Сама Гуландом на сегодняшний день предоставляет услугу. Она открыла небольшую столовую, где национальная кухня. Гуландом берет кредит для приобретения новой посуды, кухонной мебели и покупки продуктов.
texts.en: Gulandom's last loan was used to buy flour.  Now her son is working in her store and Gulandom is offering a different service.  She has opened a small cafeteria, where she serves national dishes.  She is asking for a loan to buy new dishes, furniture and food products.

loans.use: to buy new dishes, furniture and food products.

loans.name: María Delia

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 63 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de flores artificiales, las elabora artesanalmente junto con su hermana; esta actividad la realiza desde hace 50 años, fue su abuela quien les enseño y ellas de esa forma han mantenido a su familia. 

Todos los productos que necesita los compra en la ciudad más cercana, que esta a 20 kilómetros de su casa; tiene que salir muy temprano de su casa para regresar temprano con las compras y trabajar en la elaboración de las flores. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar alambre, papel, cartón, plástico, espelma, colores; para elaborar las flores. De esta manera, elaborara mayor cantidad de flores con los que formara coronas y ramos para el día de los santos difuntos, obteniendo mejores ingresos para su familia.

Ella desea continuar con su trabajo y enseñarles a sus nietas esta actividad, para que puedan obtener un ingreso.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old and has one son. She makes and sells artificial flowers. She makes them by hand with her sister and has done this activity for 50 years. Their grandmother taught them and this is how they have supported their family. 

She buys all of the products she needs in the nearest town, which is 20 kilometers from her house. She has to leave her house very early to get back early with the purchases and work on making the flowers. 


The loan she is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy wire, paper, cardboard, plastic, wax, and colors to make the flowers. This way, she can make more flowers to use for wreaths and bouquets for All Saints Day, obtaining more income for her family. 

She wants to keep working and teach her granddaughters this activity so they can make an income.

loans.use: to buy wire, paper, cardboard, plastic, wax, and colors to make flowers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Don Carmen tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y  tiene cuatro hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, aprendió este oficio gracias a su padre y es así como él se ha desempeñado en últimos años. 

Todos los productos que necesita los compra en la ciudad más cercana, que esta a 8 kilómetros de su casa; para salir tiene que levantarse bien de madrugada, para tomar el autobús, sino le toca caminar a pie hasta la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz y de fríjol, debido a que en este momento necesitan el abono para que su producción sea abundante. Lo que desea es sembrar más para obtener más producto.
texts.en:
Carmen is 52 years old. He is married and has four children. He has been a farmer since he was a child and learned this trade thanks to his father. This is what he has done in the last few years. 

He buys all of the products he needs in the nearest town, which is 8 kilometers from his house. To get there he has to get up very early to take the bus, or else he has to walk to town. 

The loan he is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crops, because they need fertilizer at this time so the yield will be abundant. What he wants is to plant more to obtain more product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Bailarinas Del Fraile 2 Group

texts.es: Bailarinas del fraile 2 es la otra mitad del grupo bailarinas del fraile, pensaron que eran demasiadas y de esa forma decidieron separarse. Juana Ma es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es casada, su esposo es obrero y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 14 años los cuales estudian. Ella se dedica a la venta de barbacoa y menudo; comenzó vendiendo tacos y barbacoa por kilo desde hace 3 años aproximadamente, ya que enfrente de su casa empezaron a hacer construcciones y le pareció buena idea. El crédito la ayudara para poder comprar una estructura para su negocio. Una meta que tiene la señora Juana es ampliar su negocio tener un pequeño local para no tener que vender en la calle.
texts.en: Bailarinas del Fraile 2 is the other half of the Bailarinas del Fraile group. They thought there were too many of them and decided to separate. Juana Ma is one of the members of this group. She is married and her husband is a laborer. She has 2 children, aged 7 and 14. They are in school. She sells barbecue and giblets. She started selling tacos and barbecue by the kilo about 3 years ago, since there was contrstruction going on across from her house and it seemed like a good idea. The loan will help her to buy a structure for her business. One goal Juana has is to expand her business to have a small locale so she doesn't have to sell on the street.

loans.use: to buy a structure for her business.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, San is a 35-year-old married woman with one daughter, a school-aged child. San and her husband earn income for the family through their rice-farming business. They have been in this business for 18 years. They earn approximately 18,000 KHR each day and manage to save around 9,000 KHR after offsetting the daily expenses. The rice field produces a low-quality crop yield, so she is in need of money to buy fertilizers to help improve the quality of her crops. 

San leads a group of five female members, all of whom are first-time borrowers with VisionFund. They are taking out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Besides buying fertilizers, San will use a portion of her very first requested loan to rent a water pump in order to provide sufficient water for her crops. After receiving this loan and using it in a smart manner, San strongly believes that her family's living conditions will be much better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kimyen's Group

texts.en:
Kimyen, 55, is a villager residing in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia. She is married and has two sons, both of whom are employed as taxi drivers. To support the family, Kimyen and her husband work as rice farmers on one-and-a-half hectares of farmland. Kimyen has more than 30 years of experience in her current business, which enables her to earn around 18,000 KHR per day. 

Kimyen’s group consists of four female members who are all first-time borrowers with VisionFund. As the group's representative, Kimyen is leading her group to apply for a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR in total. With her loan portion of this loan, Kimyen will purchase fertilizer and rent a water pump so that the rice field has sufficient water. This hard-working farmer, Kimyen, hopes to see an improvement in her business as well as her family's living standards..

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rent a rice pump for her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hanifaan

texts.en:
Hanifaan is a 40-year-old married woman. She is a hard-working lady and is very eager to work to support her family. She started her business selling milk 10 years ago. She serves well in her community and maintains a good client list. Her husband assists her in selling the milk door-to-door. One of her sons also helps her in this business while other children are in school.

Hanifaan is working hard to fulfill the needs of her children. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will increase her sales and net income. She hopes to utilize the earned revenues to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
A 55-year-old widow residing in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Savy is a mother of five children. Savy’s main income comes from rice-growing and she complements it by selling grocery items. Each day, she earns around 20,000 KHR and, after deducting her daily expenses, saves approximately 10,000 KHR. 

Savy leads a group of three members, all females and first-time borrowers with VisionFund, who are taking out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As group leader, Savy will spend her loan portion on fertilizer and pesticide. This single mother, Savy, strongly believes that the loan will help her improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en:
Saveoun, 32, lives in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with two daughters who are both students. To meet the family’s needs, Saveoun and her husband have two businesses, a rice-growing business and a pig-raising business. Saveoun has more than ten years of experience in her current businesses. She earns approximately 18,000 KHR per day and, after offsetting the daily cost of living, saves around 9,000 KHR for her future needs. 

Saveoun, a first-time borrower with VisionFund, is leading her group member, also a first-time borrower, to take out a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR in total. In hopes of fattening her pigs and harvesting high-quality crop yields, Saveoun will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer and pig feed. With the help of this loan portion, Saveoun believes that she can provide a decent quality of life for her beloved family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pig feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 56-year-old married man from Marka, Amman, Jordan who has 3 family members. He is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for his daughter's university tuition. He hopes in the future for his daughter to continue her education and he wants to buy a car

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Ms Suriya is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of six. She has been running a general store for the last twenty years. She started her business at a very small level and expanded it gradually. She has gained many customers; they regularly come to her store to buy goods for daily use. In order to fast-track her business growth, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer to get a loan in the amount of 25,000 PKR. With this loan, she will be able to purchase stocks of sugar, flour and oil to meet her customers' demands. She has been involved with Kashf Foundation for four years. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on providing a high-quality education to her children. Her husband feels proud of her and feels happy with the growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, flour and oil for her general store.

loans.name: Rong's Group

texts.en:
A villager residing in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Rong is 41 and married. She is also the mother of four children, one of whom (her daughter) is still her responsibility. Having been a teacher for 21 years, Rong earns around 22,000 KHR per day. To increase her family's income, Rong’s husband works as a rice farmer on 3.5 hectares of farmland. Due to insects, the crops were of low quality. This low quality forced Rong’s husband to sell the crop for lower prices than usual. As a result, the family's income declined, motivating Rong to request her first loan from VisionFund to buy pesticides for her husband’s business. 

The first loan has improved the quality of the crops. Now, Rong is in need of more money to buy more fertilizer to improve crop yield, which will allow her husband to sell the crops at a higher price. Therefore, she decided to request another loan after the first loan ended. Because of her good performance during the first loan cycle, Rong was appointed to be a group leader. With her group member, she is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,700,000 KHR in total. After receiving her loan portion and using it wisely, Rong hopes that her husband’s rice-farming business, which forms a big part of the family’s income, will provide him with better quality crop yields. This will allow her husband to boost the family's income. They will use some portion of the anticipated income to buy spare parts for a tractor to further improve their farming capabilities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Theoun's Group

texts.en: Theoun, 37, lives in the Kandieng district of Cambodia's Pursat province. She is married and has four children (three daughters and one son), all of whom are students. To feed her family, Theoun works as a rice farmer while her husband complements the income by selling ice cream. A first-time borrower with VisionFund, Theoun is leading a group member, also a first-time borrower, to request a loan in the amount of 600,000 KHR in total. With her requested loan portion, which is 400,000 KHR, Theoun plans to buy two sacks of fertilizer. The rest of the loan will be used as working capital to support her husband's business. Theoun dreams of expanding her husband's business so that the family’s income can increase.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Chaily's Group

texts.en: Chaily, 62, resides in a rural area of Sampov Meas district in Cambodia's Pursat province. She is a widow with four children. As a single mother, Chaily works as a rice farmer and grocery seller to earn a living for her family. A first-time borrower, Chaily is leading a group of three female members who all are also first-time borrowers with VisionFund. They are applying for a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 KHR in total. With her portion of this loan, which is 200,000 KHR, Chaily will purchase fertilizer to apply to her farmland and more grocery items to satisfy her customers. She would be very happy to see the improvement of her family's living standard after receiving her loan portion and using it efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Seham

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Seham prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus, the photo above is of her son. 

Seham is a 49-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan who supports 2 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her son's university tuition. She hopes for her son to continue his education, and she wants to buy a home in the future.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: Justo es casado desde hace varios años, radican en el trópico de Cochabamba, en la comunidad de san miguel del municipio de entre ríos, desde hace 11 años. El cliente es de la provincia Chiu-. Bustillo del departamento de Cochabamba, uno de los lugares mas pobres de Bolivia, vino de su comunidad como la mayoría de las personas buscando mayor oportunidad de vida, en su comunidad la producción bajo debido a los cambios climatológicos, difícil de controlar, cada ves la producción escaso, por lo que decidió ir la trópico, pero con el  transcurso del tiempo, con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo se compro su lote agrícola, en la que hoy en día trabaja en el sector agrícola. El crédito que esta solicitando es para mantenimiento de sus productos agrícolas como ser parcelas de cítricos, plátanos y palta así de esta manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida. Y también su señora siempre esta colaborando en sus actividades, tienen tres hijos que aun esta en el colegio.
texts.en: Justo has been married for several years. They have lived for 11 years in the tropics of Cochabamba, in the community of San Miguel in the municipality of Entre Ríos. Justo is from the province of Chiu-Bustillo in the department of Cochabamba, one of the poorest places in Bolivia. He came from his community, like the majority of people, looking for better opportunities in life. In his region, production decreased due to climate changes, difficult to control, and production was falling short every time, which is why he decided to go to the tropics. With the passing of time, and with much work and effort he bought his agricultural plot. The loan he is requesting is for the upkeep of his agricultural products such as plots of citrus fruits, bananas and avocados. In this way, he will be able to improve his quality of life. His wife also always collaborates in the activities. They have three children that are still in school.

loans.use: to maintain his agricultural land for citrus fruits, bananas and avocados.

loans.name: Na

texts.en:
A hard-working villager named Na resides in a rural area of the Kandieng district of Pursat province, Cambodia. A 55-year-old widow, she is the mother of four children. Na makes her living by growing rice on a one-hectare farm. She has been involved in her current business for twenty years. Each day, she earns approximately 15,000 KHR, but she saves only 5,000 KHR after deducting her daily costs of living. 

Na has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already. With these loans, she has successfully increased the working capital of her rice-growing business, which is her family's main source of income. One extra thing that has made Na so satisfied is that the past loans that she obtained have allowed her to advance her children’s education. Now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. Na will use part of her loan to buy fertilizer. The rest of it will be spent on materials for building a house, such as wood, sand, cement, etc. She believes that this loan will provide her with higher crop yields and allow her to build a house. She will use her anticipated income to further advance her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en:
Nim is 59 years old and lives in the Sampov Meas district located of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with five children, one of whom, her son, is dependent on her. To make a living, she has a business selling desserts. 

Nim is a third-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The help that she has already received in the form of past loans has enabled her to increase her working capital. Now, she is leading a group of three female members to apply for a new loan. With her portion of this new loan, which is 1,400,000 KHR, Nim will buy wood to build a proper stall for her business. She dreams of running a small store at home that enables her to sell dessert more conveniently. She would also like to sell some grocery items so that she can boost her income even higher.

loans.use: to buy wood to build a food stall.

loans.name: Abril Group

texts.es: Abril es un grupo solidario conformado por 6 mujeres, llamado de esa forma porque una de las hijas de las integrantes del grupo se llama así. Sanjuana es una mujer de 37 años, vive en unión libre, su esposo es soldador con experiencia de 14 años, ya que siempre laboro para empresas y sus 4 hijos, una de 20 años (esta embarazada), de 13, 8 y 4 años, todos nos estudiantes y la niña de 13 le ayuda a vender. Sanjuana de dedica a vender elotes y raspados (yuquis) en la vía publica, tiene 12 años con la venta de raspados y 4 con la venta de elotes; comenzó vendiendo raspados en un triciclo, después un señor le paso la receta para vender elotes y encontró un buen punto para venderlos. El crédito la ayudara a comprar mas elotes, crema, chile, otros artículos que necesita para la preparación de los mismos, ya que en esta temporada no podrá vender raspados por la temporada de frio. Menciona que quiere poner otro puesto de elotes para mejorar las ventas, ya que le va muy bien.
texts.en: Abril is a solidarity group of six women, named after one of the daughters of one of the members. Sanjuana is 37 years old, and lives in a civil union. Her spouse has worked as a welder for 14 years for various companies. Their four children are aged 20 (this one is pregnant), 13, 8, and 4. They go to school.  The 13-year old daughter helps Sanjuana with her business. Sanjuana sells corn on the cob, snow cones (also called 'yuquis') from a street stand. She has been selling snow cones for 13 years and corn on the cob for 4. She started her business by selling snow cones from a tricycle, and then a man taught her the recipe for corn on the cob and she found a good spot to sell those. The loan will help her to buy more corn, cream, chilli, and other ingredients to prepare corn on the cob, since with the cold season, her snow cone sales will be going down. She says that she is doing very well and is looking to set up a second corn-on-the-cob stand in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make corn on the cob to sell.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
A resident of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Cambodia, Phon is a 53-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom (her daughter) is a school-aged child and still dependent on her. Phon earns her living by selling grocery items and food, such as noodles and cooked rice with a variety of dishes. 

This will be Phon’s fourth time requesting a loan via Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is very happy with the past loans that she obtained because she has successfully increased her working capital, which is crucial for business. Now she is leading a group of five female members to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. With the help of her portion of this loan, she will be able to buy more grocery items, such as soap, shampoo, sugar, canned items, and so on; this will help her meet her customers' needs. After receiving her loan, she believes that she will be able to improve customer satisfaction and thereby boost her income.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, aged 49, is married and resides in Siem Reap province, Srey Snom district, Cambodia. She has five children; one (a daughter) is a student. To better support her family, Sokha farms rice on a three-hectare farmland and plants cassava on a one-hectare farmland. She has more than 25 years of experience in her current businesses, earning approximately 10,000 KHR per day and managing to save around 5,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. 

A first-time borrower, Sokha is applying for a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 KHR. She will spend a portion of the requested loan on buying a motorcycle and a tractor. The other portion of her loan will be spent on supporting her children’s education. Her biggest hope in the future is to be able to fully support the education of her children so that they will be able to stand on their own feet as well as find good jobs.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and a tractor

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en:
Hamzah is a 28-year-old married man from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to pay for wedding-related expenses.  He would like to buy furniture and some other household items for his home. He hopes in the future to improve his living standard.

Since Hamzah is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for wedding expenses

loans.name: 05.03.39 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Trang has a business that provides housing rentals. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to repair a house for renting.

Trang is 61 years old and married with two children.

Trang is the group leader of the 05.03.39 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Trang lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa, a semi-urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her children are grown up.

This is Trang's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Trang has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Trang faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Trang hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, that her business will do well and that her children will find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair a house for renting.

loans.name: 03-05-30 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuyến has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food for resale. 

Xuyến is 55 years old and married with three children.

Xuyến is the group leader of the 30-05-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa, a semi-urban area in the Thanh Hoa province. She has no dependents since her children are grown up.

In 2004, Xuyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Xuyến has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Xuyến has been involved in this business for two years.

The main hardship that Xuyến faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Xuyến hopes her family will be healthy and happy, that her business will do well, and that her children will find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase dry food for resale.

loans.name: Roeurng

texts.en:
Roeurng is 49 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 daily. Her children are employed. They earn about $7 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Roeurng is requesting a loan of $1350 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business in order to earn more income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is 42 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating agricultural crops and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. He earns about $5 each day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $3 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Phally is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase piglets to raise and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and resell when they gain weight

loans.name: 09.03.02 -  Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Hiền is 35 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 9-member group, the 09.03.02 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. 

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hiền hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and, with her business profit,  for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: 09.03.01 - Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Dậu is applying for a loan to purchase dry food to resell. She has a retail business selling dry food.

Dậu is 54 years old and married with two children.

Dậu is the group leader of the 09.03.01 Phú Sơn3 solidarity group, which consists of nine members. 

Dậu lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her children are grown up.

This is Dậu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Dậu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Dậu faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In the future, Dậu hopes to build a new house, that her business will do well, and that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase dry food for resale.

loans.name: 040401- Hảisơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cúc operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to fish.

Cúc is 31 years old and married with two children.

She is the leader of a four-member group, the 040401 HảiSơn - Hoằng Trường solidarity group. 

Cúc supports three dependents with her business, which is located in Hoang Hoa, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.

In 2002, Cúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Cúc has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Cúc has been involved in this business for seven years.

The main hardship that Cúc faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In the future, Cúc hopes that her business will do well, that she will be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and that she will be able to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish.

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en: Sopha is 29 years old. She is married and lives with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running hair salon for more than seven years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $4 daily. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sopha is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase lotions and powder to resell. This purchase will help her generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase lotions and powder to resell.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira, from Solana, is happily married to Armando and they have three children. Rice farming is the family's viable source of income. They plant and harvest rice twice a year and generate about P15,000 each harvest season. Almira is sending her three children to school; that is why she aims to further improve their crop production. 

She is now asking for additional capital of P30,000 to buy four bags of rice seeds, its fertilizers and to pay for land preparation. She also hires laborers to help them sow, plant and transplant rice seedlings.

Someday, Almira would like to achieve more productive harvests and keep earning good profits from the business. This will ensure good repayments on education expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy four bags of rice seeds, its fertilizers and to pay for land preparation.

loans.name: Harryson

texts.en:
Harryson is a responsible husband who grows rice to sell to traders at their village. He is 27 years old, married to Eunice and they have no child yet. While Harryson grows rice, his wife also manages a small store, selling grocery items. The couple both engaged in a business so they would achieve financial stability. 

In order to sustain his crops, Harryson would like to add fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides to his rice crop so it will attain healthy growth. He is requesting P20,000 to buy these supplies for his farming business. 

Harryson is hoping to have a child and to give a fortunate life to his family someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides use in the farming business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia runs a small store where she sells grocery items to the people in her village. From this, she gains about 5,000 PHP, just enough for her family's sustenance. She is married to Emilio, a farmer. She aims to increase her profits, but had inadequate funds to invest in her business. Now she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP. This will be used to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and soap to sell in her store. 

Leticia also wanted to develop good relationships with all her customers, which will help lead to increased sales capacity from her business. Additional revenue will be used for school expenses. Her photo was taken inside her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: 040305-Thành Xuân  - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyên  operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to fish.

Nguyên is 52 years old and married with three children.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 040305-Thành Xuân  - Hoằng Trường solidarity group. 

Nguyên supports one dependent since her other two children are grown. Her business is in Hoang Hoa, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.

In 2002, Nguyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nguyên has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nguyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Nguyên faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In the future, Nguyên hopes to make enough money to provide for her children. She also hopes her business will do well and that she will be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish.

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en: Samphors is 25 years old. She is married and lives with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $7 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Samphors is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase pigs to breed and resell after they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn additional income to support the family financially . In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to breed and resell after they gain weight.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Sareth is 32 years old. She is single and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 daily. In order to improve her finances, Sareth is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase farmland to use for growing rice. This purchase will help her generate additional income to pay her daily living expenses. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop and rebuild her present house.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to grow rice.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Kea is 33 years old. She is married and lives with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband sells charcoal and earns about $7 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Kea is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a threshing machine to rent out. This purchase will help her generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a threshing machine to rent out.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a proud entrepreneur who sells beef and pork meat at the public market. Her family lives in Libag but their meat stall is located at the public market where sales opportunities are in high demand. She is 46 years old and has two children. 

She is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy more pork and beef meat to sell. She would like to keep selling good products so she will gain more profits, which are necessary for paying school fees on time. Her photo was taken at the meat shop with her husband beside her.

loans.use: to buy more pork and beef meat to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 45-year-old married woman. She is a very active working woman who has been involved in carpet making work for the past three years with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Yasmeen’s husband. She has been skilled since her childhood, as her mother was also doing the same work. She offers various handmade carpets and is famous for providing good quality products in her circle. She is happily doing it with her husband for the sake of her family.

Yasmeen struggled very hard to improve her business gradually for which she has been taking loans from Kashf Foundation for the past three consecutive years. Because of her trust in this institution, she requested a loan of Rs.45,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, polypropylene fibers, etc. She wants her business to expand every year by making products competing with market standards.

loans.use: To buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, polypropylene fibers, etc.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Ms Sana is a 27-year-old unmarried lady. She has been in the business of making jewellery boxes for 12 years. She has tremendous skill in doing it. Initially she made boxes for her friends and relatives, but now she has become famous in her community, catering to a large number of customers. 

She makes enough to provide for her family. Her father is employed in a government office and earns an income that is too low to meet the needs of the family members alone. 

In order to expand her business, Sana contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase hard boards and cardboard in large quantities to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To purchase hard boards and cardboard in large quantities to increase her sales.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana, 58, is married with six children. She has a sewing services business. She sews curtains, tablecloths, and school uniforms to sell. Susana would like to improve her sewing services, so she is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy fabric, needles, thread and buttons. Someday, with good output, she will gain more income and additional customers, allowing her to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, thread and buttons to use in her sewing services

loans.name: Youy's Group

texts.en:
Youy, 44, is a married father of four children living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Three of his children are dependent on him. He is a rice farmer who grows rice on a 10-hectare farm. He has been in the business for almost twenty years, and he can earn about 60,000 KHR per day. He can save about 30,000 KHR each day after meeting his daily expenses. Insufficient working capital to support his rice paddy is still his main challenge.  
This is Youy's second loan from VisionFund, and he has fully repaid his first loan, which helped him to support his family and pay for his children’s education. Now he is leading his group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his rice production, to so as to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Bunthy's Group

texts.en:
Bunthy, 45, is married and living with his family in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He has three sons, all of whom are dependent on him and still in school. For the last ten years, Bunthy has been farming rice on five-hectares of farmland, which is the main source of the family’s income for making a living. Besides this, his wife makes desserts for selling in the local area to gain extra income. Together, they can earn about 26,000KHR per day from the current businesses and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 
   
Bunthy’s group consists of five members and he is a seventh cycle client with VisionFund. The past loans, which he successfully repaid, have helped him support his family's living conditions. Now leading his group of five to request a loan with VisionFund, Bunthy, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on gasoline. He hopes to grow his rice healthfully and timely so as to make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sophal is age 56 years and married. She has six children to take care of, one (daughter) of whom is dependent and still in school. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer on a ten-hectare area of farmland for ten years. The current business earns her about 30,000KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Sophal’s group consists of five members who are all females, and she is in her first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Sophal is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend for gasoline and labor. She hopes to make healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is a retailer of cosmetics and home products, such as soap, shampoo and detergents, to the people in her neighborhood. She has been doing it for over three years now and wants to increase her merchandise. That is why she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy lotion, perfumes, soap and shampoo to sell. This will help increase her sales. Aside from a good income, she also hopes to keep extending good services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy lotion, perfumes, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is an industrious entrepreneur who sells used clothing to the people in her village. She has been doing it for over three years now and generates about 4,000 PHP each month. She is very happy with her income but still needs to increase it so she can sustain her family and give her children the best education possible. She is now asking for a loan of 8,00 PHP to buy more used clothes, bags, and belts to sell.

She hopes to keep making her business profitable and gain the income necessary to raise her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes, bags, and belts to sell.

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Roen is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still in school and dependent on her. To support the family, Roen has been farming rice on four hectares of farmland for several years, and her husband supplements his family’s income by catching fish. From their current businesses, they can earn about 18,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Roen has been with VisionFund for six cycles and has fully paid back the past loans; the other member is just starting with VisionFund this cycle. She has wisely used the past loans to relieve her family’s burden. Now, Roen and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she wants to use a portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm. With this loan, Roen hopes to get a high yield from her rice-farming business so she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Soknay

texts.en:
A mother living in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Soknay is 32 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are dependents and still in school. For the past eight years, Soknay has been selling fish to support her family, while her husband works as a policeman in local area. 
Soknay has been a member of VisionFund for two loan cycles, and she has completely repaid her loans. She has used the loans from VisionFund to provide better support for her family, providing enough food and meeting their basic necessities. She can earn about US$10 per day from her current business and save about US$5 each day for future needs. Now Soknay is requesting a new loan of US$500. She wants to use this loan to buy a cow for her farm, and she will also use a portion of it to buy fish for resale. Soknay hopes this loan will enable her to have a cow as a farm animal to help in her farming business, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her farm.

loans.name: Sreytouch's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Sreytouch is 38 years old and single. To make a living, Sreytouch has been growing rice for ten years and supplementing her income by selling various kinds of vegetables such as cabbages, salad, cucumbers, etc. She can earn about 25,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for her future needs.
Sreytouch received her first loan four cycles ago, and she has completely repaid the loans from VisionFund. With the loans from VisionFund, she has improved her standard of living. Now leading her group of two to apply for another loan, Sreytouch will use this loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticides for her farm. Sreytouch hopes this loan will enable her rice farm to become more productive, so as to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Lab's Group

texts.en:
Lab, 48, is a married mother living in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She has six children, two of whom are dependents; one is in school, while the other works in a garment factory to help the family generate income. She is a hard-working farmer who grows rice and sells various kinds of vegetables, such as cucumber, salad, etc., while her husband supplements the family income by working as a taxi-driver in the local area. By both working hard, they can earn about 33,000 KHR per day and save about 10,00 0KHR each day for their future needs. 
Lab’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for four cycles. Lab fully repaid her past loans, which have helped her to gradually improve her family’s standard of living. Now she and her fellow group member are applying for a new loan from VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm and pay for plowing and other farm labor. She hopes to produce more rice and thus increase the family’s income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and pay farm labor.

loans.name: Kro Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Kro Nhanh is 48 years old and married with four children. To make a living, she has been producing Khmer noodles for selling for 15 years as her primary business, while her husband works hard as a rice farmer to gain extra income for the family. 

Kro Nhanh’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. Kro Nhanh has been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles already and completely paid back the loans, which have helped better support her family’s living to an extent. Now, she can earn about 25,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business and can save about 6,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor fees. Kro Nhanh hopes to increase her crop yields and sell for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, 45, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She has seven children, two of whom are dependent and still in school. For the last 20 years, she and her husband have been growing oranges on 1.5-hectare of farmland as a primary source of family income to make a living; they supplement the income by raising pigs. The current business earns her family about 13,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and they can save about 3,000 KHR each day for the future needs. A lack of a water supply is the main challenge for her plantation business. 

Sopheap is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 3,500,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her plantation business and will use a portion of it to spend on buying piglets for raising. She hopes to make more fruitful oranges so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her orange plantation business.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Leng is 38 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. For the last 19 years, she has been growing rice to support her family, while her husband works as a construction worker in the local area to earn additional income. Together, they can earn about 22,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 
Leng’s group consists of two members who have been with VisonFund for four cycles. Leng has completely repaid her past loans, which have helped her lighten the burdens of her family and improve their livelihood. Now she and her fellow group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Leng, the group's leader, is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to succeed in producing more rice, so as to improve her family’s living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

loans.name: Chanry's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with thatched walls in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Chanry is aged 39 years and married with no kids. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and selling firewood. Having been in this business for 13 years, they are able to earn about 17,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and they can save about 6,000 KHR each day for their future needs. Insufficient working capital to support her current business is the main challenge she faces.

Chanry’s group consists of two members who live in the same village, and she has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. The past loan, which she fully paid back, has supported her family with enough food. Now, she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chanry will use her portion to buy plots of farmland for her rice farming. She hopes this loan will enable her to have more plots of farmland to grow her rice timely and fruitfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy plots of farmland for her rice farming.

loans.name: Sengheap's Group

texts.en:
Sengheap, 19, lives with family members in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district, and she has one daughter who is dependent and still too young for school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting oranges and sugarcane, which they both have been in for 10 years to make a living. The current business earns them about 16,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and they can save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs.  

This is the first microloan for Sengheap’s group with VisionFund. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan, Sengheap, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living and keep her daughter in school when she is old enough.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra is 27 years old and lives with her family in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married with two children, all of whom are dependents and still too young for school.

Rice farming has been the only main source of income for her family for seven years. Her husband also complements the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about 12,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 6,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Ra’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle while her group member is just with VisionFund this cycle. She successfully used the loans from VisionFund to improve her family’s living condition and now she is confident she can make a better living.

Ra's group is requesting a loan from VisionFund. Ra, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow rice healthily and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Mathurine

texts.fr: Agée de 43ans, Mathurine est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 19ans et 12ans. Elle vend de divers et des boissons depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mathurine is 43 years old, married, and mother of three children, all of whom have received schooling. Her eldest child is 19 years old, and her youngest child is 12 years old.

She has been selling beverages and various other items for a few years now, and she stocks up at one of the markets in Benin.

Striving to strengthen her business and satisfy the demand of her customers, she sought and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev with a view to maximizing her supplementary income and helping to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of corn, 5 containers of sardines, and 12 cases of assorted beverages

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Ms. Sadia is a 22-year-old unmarried lady. She is very talented and excels in her stitching work. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community, so she decided to initiate her own business with support of Kashf Foundation. She is living with her parents and has four siblings; she is the eldest among them. Her father is a government servant. His income is not enough to cover family expenditures. Sadia wants to support her family by using her great talent.

Sadia requested for a loan of 20,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees) to buy a stock of threads in different colors, buttons, zips, etc., to keep up with the demand. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her siblings through all her hard slog in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, buttons, zips, etc., to keep up with the demand.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is aged 43 years and married with two children. Residing in a rural village of Pursat province, Kror Kor district, she and her husband have been farming rice and rising pigs for twelve years to make a living. To better support the family, she also sells grocery items in her local area. The current business earns her family about KHR 17,000 per day and they can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. 

Sokhom’s group consists of two members and they both have been with VisionFund for two cycles. Sokhom fully paid back the past loans and successfully used the past loans from VisionFund to better support her living and basic necessities. Now she and her group are applying for another loan. 

The leader, Sokhom, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion to buy piglets for raising. Sokhom hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for the family to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Hay's Group

texts.en:
Hay, 47, lives with her family members in a rural village of Siem Reap province, Srey Snom district, Cambodia. She has three dependent children who are still in school. For the last five years, she and her husband have been farming rice on one-hectare of farmland as the main source of her family’s income. The current business earns her about KHR 5,000 per day and she manages to save about 2,000 KHR after offsetting daily expenses.  

This is the fourth loan for Hay with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have enabled her to buy a proper motorbike for her family to use for commuting. She and her co-member are applying for another loan. Hay will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell the produce for a good price so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 46 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a soldier who earns about $3 each day. Three of her children are garment workers. They earn about $9 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating agricultural crops. This purchase will help her increase income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating.

loans.name: Makara

texts.en: Makara is 30 years old. She is married, has one child and resides in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been selling jewelry for more than two years, earning approximately $15 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Makara is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more jewelry to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. She would like to buy a store in the future, and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to resell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 21, who is married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family. 

Ali is a blacksmith. He started working in this field in 2006 and after having a good experience he established his own business. He has now 2 employees and a good reputation in his local community. 

He is requesting $2000 as loan to buy a generator and buy more raw materials. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and fattening up cattle for more than seven years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a knife and ax maker. He earns about $5 daily. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Rin is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase metal for her husband to use for producing more knives and axes to sell. This money will help him earn more income for the family. In the future, Rin would like to expand the businesses and send her children to earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase metal for her husband to use for producing more knives and axes to sell

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en:
Roeurn is 45 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 each day. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $12 per day.

In order to finish the construction of her house, Roeurn is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase timbers. This purchase will help her finish the building of her house faster. In the future, she would like to purchase a store in the market to sell groceries and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a bathroom to provide good hygiene for her family.

loans.use: to purchase timber to finish construction of her house

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is a 47-year-old widowed mother of four children in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. All of her children are dependent on her; some are still in school and some help the family’s business. 

Besides rice farming, Oun also complements the income by working for others for a fee. Having been in this occupation for 23 years, they are able to earn almost 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from drought is the main challenge for her paddy-field business.

Oun has been with VisionFund for one cycle and fully paid back the past loan. She has wisely used the previous loan to better support her family living’s conditions. 

Oun is now asking for another loan with VisionFund of 2,500,000 KHR. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, Oun hopes to cultivate her rice healthfully to earn more income to improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Theng

texts.en:
Theg is 45 years old and a widowed mother who has been blessed with four children. She resides in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

As a widow, she has struggled to feed her family by farming rice and growing beans and cassava. Engaging in this business for 20 years, Theng can earn approximately KHR 35,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses.
  
Theng has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles. The past loans, which she successfully paid back, have relieved her family’s burden and supported her children’s education. 

Now she would like to acquire a loan of KHR 3,000,000 from VisionFund. Theng will use this loan to pay for labor fees and to purchase rubber seedlings for planting to gain additional income for the family. Theng hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach is 41 years old and a married mother of five children. Out of her children, she still has three children to take care of and they are still in school. 

The main income of the family is from growing cassava on one hectare of farmland. Involved in this business for 21 years, Mach is able to earn about 16,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

The low price of cassava is still the main challenge.
 
Mach has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Her group co-member is new with VisionFund this cycle. Now, she and her co-member are applying for a loan. Mach, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for cultivated land. Mach hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice successfully so as to improve hygienic living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for cultivated land.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is a 49 year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is been in the business of selling milk for many years. Her husband does labor work and his daily income is very low. It was very difficult for her to cover the necessities of life with the income of her husband. So she decided to help her husband as well as her family. For this purpose, she purchased a buffalo five years ago and started selling the milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk. She counts a good client list. Her business is good enough for her to lead a  decent life. She worked hard and made savings for expanding her business and now she has two buffaloes and good number of customers.  She needs a loan of Rs.30,000 for purchasing a buffalo because her customers are increasing day by day.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Touch is 56 years old and originally from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province. She has five children and all of them have their own employment, working on rice fields, clothes tailoring, and working at a construction site.  Her main source of family income is from rice farming, which she has been doing for 15 years and from which she is able to earn almost 13,000 KHR per day.  Now in a group of three, Touch is a group leader. This is her fifth-time loan with Kiva's partner. Her past loan, which she has paid back, has supported her cash-crops growing on time and returns her a decent income. Now she is applying for 300,000 KHR.  She is going to use it to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this purchase will boost her productivity, so she can make more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married, and has two children. His parents live with him and they are employed. 

Alaa owns a carpentry shop. He has acquired this profession by working as an employee in carpentry shops for several years. In 2010, he established his own shop. He now has two employees and a good reputation in his local community.
