location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy accessories to resell

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province (Cambodia), Khon is a cassava-growing farmer using her one hectare of farmland in order to provide decent food for all of her four school children. She has engaged in this business for 10 years and is able to earn about 16,700 KHR per day. However, her main challenge is the low price of cassava which seriously affects her daily income. 

Khon has not been with VisionFund before. Now, she has formed a group with other two members, the second-cycle loan clients, to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that this purchase will minimal the loss due to pests and boost productivity. She believes that she will receive a larger yield, so she can keep a good pace of her business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Sengheab's Group

texts.en:
Aged 41 and a citizen of Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham Province, Sengheab is married and also one of the breadwinners in her family consisting of five children. Two out of her children are still in school and still mainly need her support. To overcome the family hardship, she and her husband grow paddy on their two and half hectares of farmland, which they have been doing for 20 years and are able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day. 

This is the original loan for Sengheab and her other two members; it is a group composed of three members and Seangheab is the leader. The entire requested loan amount is 2,000,000 KHR, of which 500,000 KHR is the portion of Sengheab. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes to boost its output and get back high income in order to sustain her household.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is a 43-year-old divorced female from Al Bayader in Jordan. She has a child and requested a 800 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses. Souad is looking forward to improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement expenses

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
An original citizen from Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Reth is a local farmer and also mother of six children. Four of her children still depend on her as some are still in school and some are too young for school. Reth has been engaged in this business for 10 years. 

Her previous loan was the original loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, and she has completely paid back the loan. After that successful loan, she feels empowered to sustain a standard of living for her family. Now, she is applying for 1,000,000 KHR and her co-member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she is going to buy fertilizer for her rice with her loan portion. She hopes to increase her income and get higher profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice.

loans.name: Alexandra Cecilia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Las Palmitas.

En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 19 años de edad, es casada y está embarazada de su primer hijo. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda o cuando lleva mercadería nueva, ella sale a recorrer tres días de la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Manta cada vez que necesita. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace   tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante. 

Sus sueños son tener su bebe y salir adelante.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city well known for its abundance of traditional items such as the straw hats known throughout the country and abroad, there is a bimonthly meeting of the members of the Las Palmitas Communal Bank.

This is where Alexandra lives. She is 19 years old, she is married, and she is pregnant with her first child. Her husband is an artisan.

Deciding to earn money on her own in order to get ahead and to help her husband with expenses at home, she started working selling all styles of clothing. She makes sales going door to door and she also makes sales from her own home, where customers come when they need a new garment or when she has new merchandise. She makes her rounds three days per week, she allows her customers to purchase on credit, and she collects payments every two weeks. She buys her merchandise in nearby Manta when needed. She has been running this business for two years and things have gone well for her. 

This loan will used to purchase more inventory, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for three lending cycles and she is grateful for the assistance that the loans provide her. She hopes to have her baby and to get ahead in life.

loans.use: Comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Lubna prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Lubna is a 37-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy children's and women's clothes to resell to friends and neighbors in the same area. She hopes to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Kholoud prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Kholoud is a 36-year-old married female from Baqa'a in Jordan. she has 2 children and requested a 1,100 JOD loan to pay for retailing in clothing. in the future, Kholoud is planning to expand her project by retailing in women's, men's, and children's clothing. Kholoud is looking forward to opening her own shop and building a home for her family.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build the upper floor of her house.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Abeer prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband, in her place.

Abeer is a 30-year-old married woman, from Jarash in Jordan. She has four children.  Abeer requested a 700 JOD loan to use in retailing clothes and home appliances.

loans.use: to do business in retailing clothes and home appliances.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Marisol, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, Marisol en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite etc. para capitalizar su tienda, La socia Marisol trabaja hace algunos años en esta su actividad, la cual le permite llevar el sustento a su familia y educar a sus hijos, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio.
texts.en:
Member Marisol belongs to the "Senor of the Earthquakes II" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is the young mother of a family and is very hard-working. Marisol continues to dedicate her time to selling products of primary necessity in her grocery store. On this occasion, Marisol is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, etc., to restock her store. 

Member Marisol has worked for some years in this activity, which allows her to sustain her family and educate her children. And for this she is very grateful to Kiva for permiting her to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Haya prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her mother.

Haya is an 18-year-old, single woman, from Jarash in Jordan. She requested a 900 JOD loan, to use for retailing in clothes business. Because Haya is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in clothes.

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en: Sana'a is a 22-year-old, married woman, who has two family members, from Jarash in Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to repaint her home. She hopes to improve her living standard in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is a 37-year-old, married woman from Jarash in Jordan. She requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvements and painting expenses. Eman would like to buy some furniture, also.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more food stock, finish building her house and cover rent for the restaurant.

loans.name: Ohoud

texts.en: Ohoud prefers that her photo not appear on the internet for cultural reasons; thus the picture above is of her husband. Ohoud is a 23 year old married woman from Nao'or, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for home improvements, including maintenance decoration. In the future she wants to expand her home and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en: Shireen is a 28-year-old, married woman who has two family members, from Jarash in Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to do maintenance of the home, and to buy some household items. She hopes to improve her living standard in the future.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her home, and some household items.

loans.name: Marlenis Esmeralda

texts.es:
Marlenis tiene 31 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos. Es una persona trabajadora y se dedica a brindar sus servicios como empleada domestica; también trabaja como jornal en la agricultura, ella tiene 26 años de desempeñar estas actividades y fue su mamá quien le enseño con mucho esfuerzo logro crecer a sus hijos y hoy en día Marlenis esta haciendo lo mismo con sus hijos, ya que es madre soltera.  Los insumos agrícolas los compra en una localidad que esta a media hora de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 4 sacos de abono, fungicidas y el resto para preparación del terreno. Con la inversión podrá cultivar y obtener una buena producción para llevar el alimento a su familia. Lo que más desea es trabajar bien fuerte para que sus ingresos sean mejores cada día y brindar a sus hijos educación.
texts.en:
Marlenis is 31 years old and the mother of four children. She is a hard worker and provides her services as a housekeeper.  She also works for a wage in agriculture.  She has been working in these activities for 26 years and it was her mother who taught her. It was with much effort that she raised her children and today Marlenis is doing the same with her children as a single mother. 

Marlenis buys agricultural inputs in a town that is half an hour from home.  The loan she is requesting is to buy 4 bags of fertilizer, fungicides and other materials to prepare the land.  With the investment she will be able to cultivate and get a good harvest to feed her family. What she most wants is to work very hard for her income to improve every day and give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of fertilizer, fungicides and other materials to prepare the land.

loans.name: Keji Felex

texts.en:
Keji is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 10.  All of them go to school.

Keji runs a restaurant and has been in business for 5 years. She has two employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 3000 SDG to purchase items such as beer and soda.  Keji’s restaurant is her only source of income. In 5 years, Keji would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Keji says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items such as beer, soda, and water for her restaurant.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia de treinta años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Juan Antonio y sus dos hijos en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos, huevos, pan, leche, jabones, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en su residencia en una zona muy transitada de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela fija  pues las personas la prefieren porque su tienda en la mas surtida del lugar, tiene productos de calidad, a buenos precios y con un excelente servicio; Dora se caracteriza por su alegría y gran amabilidad, es una mujer dedicada a su labor, emprendedora y con muchas metas por delante, dia a dia se esfuerza por ganarse un futuro mas prospero, y no piensa rendirse hasta lograrlo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y para no decepcionar a los clientes quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, jabones, etc. Dora Alicia tiene buen record de pago y es  responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Dora Alicia is 30 years old and lives with her life companion Juan Antonio and her two children in her own house. She owns a store where she sells basic needs products including basic grains, eggs, bread, milk, soap and other items. She has had this business for several years and has a lot of sales experience that allows her to obtain greater earnings. The store is located in her home in an area in which people pass by frequently. She already has many regular customers. People prefer her because her store is the most well stocked in the area, she has quality products at good prices and offers excellent service. 

Dora is known for her happiness and friendliness. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her work, entrepreneurial and has many goals for the future. Everyday she works hard to have a more prosperous future. She does not surrender until she achieves this. In recent weeks demand has increased and to not let down her clients she wants to make a new investment but needs capital to do so. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy basic grains, instant products, snacks, drinks, soaps, etc. Dora Alicia has a good payment record and is responsible. She is certain that she will pay her debt and at the same time has faith that she will bring her home economic security.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, snacks, drinks and soaps.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es: Fidelina de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a sus hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de productos de aluminio como ollas, vasos, tenedores y otros, también vende producto de limpieza, tiene varios años con el negocio y ha adquirido mucha experiencia en la venta que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; el puesto esta ubicado en una zona estratégica muy transitada por las personas, es muy conocida y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad del producto que comercia, los buenos precios y sobre todo el excelente servicio; Fidelina es una mujer activa, luchadora y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito y todos los días se esfuerza al máximo en el trabajo porque sabe que así podrá lograr ese sueño que tanto desea, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos de aluminio y productos de limpieza. Fidelina tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fidelina is forty-seven years old and lives with her children.  She sells aluminum products such as pots, cups, forks etc.  She also sells cleaning products.  She has been in this business for several years and has gained a lot of experience in the sale that obtains the most money.  Her stall is located in a strategic area that is well traveled by people.  Fidelina is well known and has many customers that prefer her quality commercial products, good prices and especially her excellent service.

Fidelina is an active hardworking woman who is very dedicated to her work.  She is always looking for alternatives that allow her to succeed and every day she tries her best at work because she knows well that she can achieve the dream that she desires.  In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to make a new investment.  This is the reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to allow her to purchase aluminum products and cleaning products. 

Fidelina has good references for payments and is very responsible.  She ensures that she will make payments in a timely manner and at the same time she trusts that the loan will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy aluminum products and cleaning products.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is a 40-year-old, married woman from Madaba in Jordan. She has four children. Zainab requested a 600 JOD loan to help her pay for home improvement expenses and buy some furniture.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement expenses and buy some furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a suspended ceiling.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: A rural farmer from Battambang Province, Sopheap is 37 years old and married. Her main source of income is from one hectare of rice-growing with support from her husband. She is able to earn about 23,000 KHR per day. Sopheap's group consists of two members; both of them are first-time borrowers. Sopheap is requesting the amount of 500,000 KHR, and her co-member is requesting 200,000 KHR. Sopheap, the group leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes this purchase will help her to increase her productivity so she can upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop.

loans.name: Iy's Group

texts.en:
Iy is 33 years old and has four children. She makes a living rice farming on seven hectares of farmland in the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Cambodia, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns about 24,000 KHR per day.

In the group of two, Iy is the leader; she and her co-member just joined this cycle with Kiva's partner. They are requesting loans for the same loan for 1,000,000 KHR each. Iy will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en: Arwa is 45 years old and the mother of four children.  To help support the family and improve their living conditions, Arwa makes delicious pickles form different types of vegetables including cucumbers, olives and eggplants.  She makes these pickles in special containers of varying sizes appropriate for families or restaurants to meet different customer’s needs.  She has applied for this loan in order to obtain more containers to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food containers.

loans.name: Lidia Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Lidia Teresa se dedica al negocio de venta de productos como arro,azucar,leche y aceite,ella lleva a lugares como Puerto maldonado,la socia tambien lleva animales como pollos,cuyes y patos,la socia se dedica a este negocio 4 años,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde vende los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite y tambien para comprar pollos,patos y cuyes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lidia Teresa is in the business of selling products like rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil.  She takes the products to places like Puerto Maldonado.  She also takes animals like chickens, guinea pigs, and ducks.  She has had this business for four years.  Her dream is to have a place to sell the animals.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil.  She will also buy chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil.  She will also buy chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Ms. Safiya is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. Four years ago she started selling lace and buttons from the corner of her house.  She chooses lace with different designs and colors by considering the taste of her customers.  

In her married life, Safiya faced many financial problems because her husband’s income is not sufficient to run a household.  But she did not lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to start her own business. Safiya buys lace of different designs in bulk from the market at lower rates and sells them in her community. She has become famous on her street for providing good quality lace in every color for every cloth type.  She has many clients and most are her neighbors. She has gradually improved her business, and now Safiya requests a loan of 30000 PKR to buy packs of lace and ribbons in different colors to meet with the demand. She intends to use the earned profits for improvement on her house.

loans.use: To buy packs of lace and ribbons in different colors to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Rasmia

texts.en: Rasmia is a 51-year-old married woman who has five family members.  She is from Jarash, Jordan.  She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD in order to pay for improvements to her home.  She would like to purchase new furniture and new electronic appliances.  In the future, she hopes to create a comfortable environment in which to live.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to her home.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Percy, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Percy  tiene 34 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos. Percy se dedica a la fabricación de estructuras metálicas de todo tipo, actividad que viene desarrollando hace algunos años y que le representa los principales ingresos económicos para el mantenimiento de su hogar. Percy está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una maquina que le permita doblar tubos de hierro, la cual le permitiría ahorrar tiempo y además  darle un mejor acabado a su trabajo.
Percy agradece a  KIVA por permitirle implementar su taller y mejorar en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Percy belongs to the communal bank "Señor de los Temblores II" in the city of Cusco, Peru. He is 34 years old, married, and has two children. He works making all kinds of metal structures, an activity he has been doing for many years, and which is the main source of income in his household.

Percy is applying for a loan to buy a machine that will allow him to bend iron tubes, which will save him time and give his work a better finish. Percy thanks KIVA for allowing him to outfit his workshop and improve his work.

loans.use: to buy a machine to bend metal.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
La socia Barbara tiene 21 años de edad,es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,al socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como pollo,cuyes y chanchos,la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos,cuyes y chanchos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes,gallinas y chanchos y alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Barbara, age 21, lives with her life partner and has one child.  She raises animals like chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.  She makes them grow and fattens them, and then she sells them at the different fairs.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Her dream is to have a place where she could sell the chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and feed for the animals.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy children's clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to perform maintenance on his machines and modern games.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en: A farmer with 13 years’ experience in rice growing, Phan is married and has four children. Two of her children are in school and the other two are still too young for schooling. Besides helping on the rice farm, her husband also earns additional income by fishing. Her business currently earns her about 15,000 KHR per day. This is the fourth loan cycle for Phan and the fifth loan cycle for the other two members in this group. She has managed her past loans with success – they have all been paid back – and relieved her family's burden. Now, she and one other member are requesting a new loan of 600,000 KHR each; the third member is asking for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, Phan will use her portion of the loan to buy fishing materials to support her husband's business. She dearly hopes to earn more income and maintain her family's condition in a proper manner.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials to support her husband's business

loans.name: Hana'a

texts.en: Hana'a is a 26 year old married woman from Jarash, Jordan. She has 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy food stuffs to sell in her store. She would like to expand her project by expanding her inventory. In the future she hopes to increase her family income. Since Hana'a is under 30 year old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs to sell in her store

loans.name: Somayah

texts.en: Somayah is a 21 year old married woman from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for home improvement and painting expenses. She is looking forward to improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Shereen

texts.en:
Shereen is a 28-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She requested a 400 JOD (Jordan dinar) loan to pay for raw materials needed to work in embroidery. Shereen is looking forward to expanding her project, to start making embroidered dresses instead of small pieces, and to participating in show rooms. Shereen is looking forward to the increase her family's income.

Since Shereen is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in embroidery.

loans.name: Assetou

texts.fr:
Madame Assetou est une femme mariée de 47 ans et mère de 8 enfants qui vit avec son conjoint et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à Bougouni dans le quartier Heremakono Nord.
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, très vite elle s'intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment aux ventes de petits ruminants apprises auprès de son oncle vendeurs de bétail. Après avoir eu un petit fonds de commerce à travers une sœur, elle décide de s’installer à son propre compte en menant l’activité apprise auprès de son oncle.à savoir l’achat vente de petits ruminants (chèvres, moutons).
Avec une expériences de plus de 6 ans, il maîtrise son activité dans laquelle elle est très sollicitée et appréciée.
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt elle est à son deuxième prêt qui sera utilisé pour  acheter; 15 chèvres. Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et environs. La vente se fait au marché à bétail de Bougouni. Sa clientèle est composée, d'éleveurs, de bouchers et des commerçants en provenance des grandes villes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000 FCFA qui servira en subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Assetou is 47 years old, married, and the mother of eight children.  She lives with her husband and children in a traditional family, in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood of Bougouni. 

Not having had the opportunity to attend school, Assetou soon got involved in income-generating activities, specifically in the trade of small ruminants, an activity she learned from an uncle who was a cattle seller.  After working for one of her sisters' small businesses, she decided to start her own business buying and selling small ruminants (goats and sheep) as learned from her uncle.  Assetou now has more than six years of experience in this field.  She is a very popular seller and enjoys a high demand from her customers.

After having duly repaid her first loan, she is now requesting a second loan, which will be used to buy 15 goats.  She buys her livestock in and around Bougouni and resells it at the cattle market in Bougouni.  She sells to cattle breeders, butchers and sellers from the major cities.

She is expecting monthly profits from this loan to reach 35,000 CFA francs, which will be used to support her family and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy some goats.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia Leonarda tiene 34 años de edad,es casada y tiene 4 hijos,al socia se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia se dedica a este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien,a la socia en sus tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita le credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Leonarda is 34 years old. She is married and has four children. She has a grocery store where she sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She has had this business for five years, and it is going very well for her. In her free time she likes to go for walks with her children. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is applying for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil wholesale

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1962 à Mahina (région de Kayes) Bintou est mariée, mère de 4 enfants et vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou dans la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle mène cette activité de commerce de pagnes, de vêtements, de bazins, de chaussures et de parures depuis plus de 10 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et réçoit des commandes de diverses marchandises, tels les tissus, bazins, chemises, parfums et des parures. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, elle  décida de collaborer avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso,  avec qui elle est à son troisième prêt, tous les deux prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce  nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 10 pièces de bazin moyen riche, 20 paires de boucles d’oreille et une quinzaine de paires de chaussures.
Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et effectue ses ventes généralement sur commande et au marché de Bougouni, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail au comptant et à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born sometimes around 1962 in Mahina (Kayes region), Bintou is married and the mother of four children.  She lives with her husband and children in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

Bintou has been selling "pagnes" (traditional West-African fabrics), clothes, damask fabrics, shoes and jewelry for more than ten years.  Thanks to her experience in this field, she is a very popular seller, and she receives orders for various goods such as fabrics (including damask), shirts, perfumes and jewelry.

In order to have the necessary resources to satisfy her customers' needs, she has decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  This is her third loan with the institution and she has duly repaid her two previous loans.

With this new loan, she will buy 10 pagnes ("moyen riche" grade), 20 sets of earrings and about 15 pairs of shoes.  She stocks up in Burkina Faso and usually sells from orders and at the Bougouni market.  She sells for cash or on credit to a retail customer base made up of men and women. 

Bintou is expecting average monthly profits from this loan to reach 45,000 CFA francs.  These profits will be used in part to pay off her loan's interest.  She will reinvest the rest of the money in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods (pagnes, earrings and shoes).

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 18 y de 16 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en universidad y los dos menores están en colegio. Su esposo es artesano.
 
Ella tiene un local en un lugar de bastante acogida turística, donde vende artesanías de todo tipo, pulseras, sombreros, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando están desocupados y más que todo los fines de semana días en que este lugar es más concurrido y que es cuando más ventas realiza, sus productos los compra a artesanos en Montecristi, lleva 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y con su local unos pocos años atrás.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que siempre los créditos le ayudan y mucho para su negocio,  siempre las ganancias que obtiene son para ayudar con los gastos de estudios de sus hijos ya que para ella esto es lo más importante. Este crédito es para comprar más  artesanías. Lleva más de dos años en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos puede financiar su negocio. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y  darles la mejor educación a sus hijo
texts.en:
The communal bank “Los Tres Ángeles” ["The Three Angels"] meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that are well-known on both the national and international levels. This is the home of the famous "Panama" hats made from toquilla fiber.

María lives in this place. She is 40 years old and married, with three children who are 19, 18 and 16 years of age. The oldest studies at the university and the two younger ones are in secondary school. Her husband is an artisan. 

She has a shop in a location visited by many tourists, where she sells all types of crafts such as bracelets and hats, among other things. She works every day from 8 am until 6 pm. Her children help her in her business when they are not busy, and above all on weekends, which is when the place is most crowded and sales are highest. She buys her products from artisans in Montecristi. She has dedicated herself to this business for 15 years, and she has had her shop for a few years. 

She is requesting a repeat loan because the loans always help her very much with her business. The earnings she obtains always go to help with the expenses for her children's studies, since this is the most important thing for her. This loan will go to buy more handicrafts. She has been in the communal bank for more than two years, and she likes it because she can finance her business with the loans. 

Her dreams are to continue making progress with her business and to give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Рустам работает таксистом на своем собственном автомобиле. В этой области он более трех лет. Рустам просит кредит для ремонта автомобиля и для проведения свадьбы своей дочери.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 55 years old and has six children.  He works as a taxi driver, using his own car.  He has been living in this region for more than three years.  He is asking for a loan to repair his car and to pay for his daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to repair his car and to pay for his daughter's wedding.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Don Ramón tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Él se dedica a la agricultura y a administrar su propia tienda en su casa desde hace seis años. Su esposa la atiende cuando él no esta en casa. Para atender su negocio se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. debido a que los clientes llegan de mañana para realizar sus compras. Cuando va a trabajar a la agricultura se levanta mas temprano, trabaja durante siete horas y luego se regresa a almorzar.  Los productos los adquiere en la ciudad, para llegar ahí debe caminar a pie hasta abordar un autobús que tarda cuarenta minutos en llegar a la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 quintales de azúcar, 3 quintales de arroz, 3 cajas de jabón, 10 fardos de lejía, 10 galones de aceite 10 cartones de huevo, sal, pan, gaseosas, baterías, tarjetas, entre otros más. Con la inversión pretende satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ya que hay ocasiones que buscar ciertos productos y él no los tiene disponibles. Su sueño es ahorrar para construir una casa de ladrillo ya que en la que vive es de bahareque y no le brinda la seguridad que necesita en su hogar para el negocio y brindar la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ramon, 54, is married and has one child.  He is a farmer, and he's also had a store in his house for 6 years.  His wife runs the store when he is not at home.  In order to attend to his business he gets up at 5am, because his customers arrive in the morning to make their purchases.  When he goes to work on the farm, he gets up even earlier, works for 6 hours, and later returns for lunch.  He acquires his products in the city; to get there he has to walk on foot until he can board a bus that takes 40 minutes to arrive in the city.

Ramon is requesting a loan from Fundacion Campo to buy 300 pounds of sugar, 300 pounds of rice, 3 crates of soap, 10 boxes of bleach, 10 gallons of cooking oil, 10 cartons of eggs, salt, bread, soft drinks, batteries, cards, and other products.  With this investment, he plans to meet the demand of his customers, because there are times when they are looking for certain products and he doesn't have them available.  Ramon's dream is to save to build a brick house, because the home he lives in is made of daub and wattle and it doesn't provide him with the security he needs for his household and his business.  He also wants to provide his child with an education.

loans.use: to buy 300 pounds of sugar, 300 pounds of rice, 3 crates of soap, 10 boxes of bleach, 10 gallons of cooking oil, 10 cartons of eggs, salt, bread, soft drinks, batteries, cards, and other products

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy, 46, is a married mother of seven children. Now, only two children are under her responsibility; one of them is still in school and another one is helping the family's business. Her sources of income are from growing rice and selling Khmer noodles. Her husband also has a job playing traditional music during special events such as weddings and religious ceremonies. 

Having been involved in this business for 21 years, she is able to earn about 22,000 KHR per day. Thy, a second-time borrower, has formed a group of two with a first-time borrower in order to apply for a new loan. Her past loan, which she has paid back fully, has helped her to better support both of her businesses on, especially by allowing her to purchase ingredients for her noodle business. Her portion of the new loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and seed for her farm. She hopes that this will give her a better crop yield and allow her to lift her family living conditions above their previous state.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro vive en el Fortín zona norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil. El tiene 45 años de edad está casado y tiene 2 hijos que no viven con  el porqué son independientes. El comenzó con la ilusión hace muchos años de tener un negocio propio y lo consiguió porque había aprendido  todo lo referente al trabajo de carpintería. Hace 1 año  Pedro abrió su propio taller de carpintería, en  el cual trabaja elaborando muebles, camas, cómodas. Como tiene poco tiempo el no ha podido contratar ayudantes por ende su esposa es quien le ayuda. Juntos salen a  trabajar todos los días desde las  8:00 am hasta 18:00pm. Con el préstamo él quiere comprar madera, barniz, pintura, herramientas etc. Su sueño es ampliar más  el negocio que tiene  y poder distribuir a un almacén sus productos.
texts.en: Pedro lives in Fortín, an area in the North of Guayaquil. He is 45 years old, married and has two children who do not live with him because they are old enough to be on their own. He began with a dream many years ago to have his own business and he achieved it because he had learned all that he needed to know in regards to working in carpentry. A year ago, Pedro opened his own carpentry workshop where he works making furniture, beds and dresser drawers. As he has very little free time,  he has not had time to hire people to help him and in the end his wife is the one who assists him. Together they leave to work every day at 8am and work until 6pm. With the loan, he will want to purchase wood, varnish, paint and tools etc. His dream is to expand his business and to be able to distribute his products to a warehouse.

loans.use: wood, paint and varnish

loans.name: Wilmer Alberto

texts.es: Wilmer  tiene 28 años de edad está casado, tiene 2 hijos una de 8 años y el otro de 1 año. Su esposa es ama de casa. El tiene un taller de ebanistería. Aprendió esta profesión ya que su padre también la ejercía y fue él quien le enseño. Con el paso del tiempo le  comenzó a gustar mucho por eso ahora tiene su propio  taller donde hace anaqueles y camas. El trabaja junto a un empleado que contrato  de lunes a sábado de 8:00am hasta 17:00pm. Con el préstamo Wilmer quiere comprar madera, pinturas, herramientas etc. Su meta es tener un  taller más grande porque ahí la producción será mayor y así podrá generar más trabajo dándoles oportunidad a  personas que no lo tengan.
texts.en: Wilmer is 28 years old, married and has two children who are 8 and 1 years old. His wife is head of the house. He owns a cabinetmaker's workshop. He learned his profession from his father who was also a carpenter and his father was the one who taught him. After some time, he began to like the idea of having his own workshop  and it is there where he makes shelves and beds. He works alongside an employee that he hires to work Monday to Saturday from 8am to 5pm. With the loan, Wilmer wants to purchase wood, paint, tools, etc. His goal is to have a bigger workshop because he would be able to have a larger production there and he would be able to get more work and give an opportunity to work to more people.

loans.use: wood, paint and tools etc.

loans.name: Olivia Briselda

texts.es: Olivia vive en el Fortín  zona norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Ella tiene 34 años de edad está casada y  tiene 2 hijos la mayor de 16 años que estudia en un colegio por el sector  y el menor de 9 años que asiste a la escuela. Su esposo es chofer de un taxi. Olivia  empezó  con su negocio propio ya hace 12 años atrás vendiendo artículos de bazar y papelería ya que después comenzó a implementar en su local todo lo respecto a víveres  para formar una  tienda. Ella vende ahora todo lo referente a gaseosas, víveres en general. En la actualidad ella también  ha incursionado en  la  venta de productos naturales. Con el préstamo Olivia quiere comprar víveres en general,  artículos de bazar y productos medicinales. Su meta es llegar a tener a futuro un gran mini market pues ese ha sido su sueño desde que era muy joven  y  gracias a la ayuda de DIOS  y a Banco D-MIRO lo realizara.
texts.en: Olivia lives in Fortín, an area in the North of the city of Guayaquil. She is 34 years old, married and has two children, the oldest of whom is 16 and goes to a local high school and the youngest is 9 years old and goes to school as well. Her husband is a taxi driver. Olivia began her business 12 years ago selling bazaar items and stationery and afterwards she began to include at her stand all kinds of different products to form a store. She now sells everything from sodas to general supplies. Currently, she is also trying to incorporate natural products. With the loan, Olivia wants to purchase more general supplies, bazaar items and medicinal products. Her goal is to have a great mini-mart in the future since this has been her dream since she was very young and thanks to the help from God and the communal bank D-MIRO, she will be able to achieve it.

loans.use: purchase general supplies, bazaar items and medicinal products.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en: Living under the thatched roof house, Thea is a widow and mother of one child.  She is 54 years old and has struggled so hard to make a living through rice farming and raising pigs.  This single mother is able to earn about 10,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has been doing for 30 years.  She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before.  Thea forms a group of two to seek a new loan.  She is seeking a loan for 300,000 KHR while her co-member is applying for 500,000 KHR.  As the leader, she will use her portion to buy feed for her pig-raising business.  She hopes to fatten her pigs to a healthy condition so that she can sell them at a higher price and gain more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
Nget, a young 23-year-old mother of one son, is married and a rural villager from Kror Kor District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has three hectares of rice cropping farmland as her main source of income. Additionally, she raises pigs and her husband works for others for a fee as extra income. He has been in this business for four years. 

This is a new loan cycle for Nget with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, and she is the leader of a group of three members. She and one of her co-members are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 riels (KHR) each, while the remaining one is applying for a 500,000 KHR loan. Nget is going to use her portion for purchasing fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a cow to make dairy products.

loans.name: Boren's Group

texts.en:
Boren is 30 years old and a mother of two children, one who is too young for school, and another who is still in school.  The rest of her family is living in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province.  She strives to make a living through selling porridge.   She has been with this business for 7 years, earning about 25,000 KHR per day.  

Boren has never been with VisionFund before (Kiva's partner).  Now, forming a group of three, she is the leader.  All of the members are first-time borrowers seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she will use her portion to buy more ingredients to support her porridge selling business (rice, sugar, salt, seasoning, etc.).  She hopes to earn more income from her current business so that she can save some money to buy a decent motorbike.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to support her porridge business.

loans.name: Blanca Marina

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 47 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y a trabajar en la agricultura junto a sus dos hijos de 17 y 18 años respectivamente; el padre de sus hijos emigro a los Estados Unidos y los abandono. Ella vive en  un caserío que esta a 20 kilómetros del pueblo; por lo que el recorrido es bastante largo para ir a adquirir los productos que necesita. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar medicamentos y para realizarse unos exámenes médicos. Así, ella tendrá un diagnostico de su enfermedad. Actualmente, manifiesta Blanca que no posee los suficientes recursos económicos para realizarse todos los exámenes y la compra de la medicina. Ella desea que sus hijos tengan una buena solvencia económica para que pueda emprender otros negocios en un futuro.
texts.en: Blanca is 47 years old and has two children. She is in charge of the domestic duties of her house and she also works in agriculture alongside her two children who are 17 and 18 years old. The children's father emigrated to the United States and abandoned them. She lives in a house that is 20 kilometers outside of town and so it is a long trip in order to get the things she needs. The loan she is applying for from Fundación Campo will be used to purchase medicines and to get a medical exam, that way she will be able to get a diagnosis for her illness. Currently, Blanca does not have the financial resources to get all of the exams she needs and to purchase medicine. She wants her children to have good economic solvency so that they can undertake other businesses in the future.

loans.use: purchase medicines and get a medical exam.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Samphors' Group

texts.en: Samphors is a 33-year-old father of three children, currently in the local public school.  He is a rural citizen from the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Cambordia.  He has three hectares for growing rice, the business that he has been with for 10 years.  This is the fifth time that Samphors borrows with Kiva's partner, VisionFund.  He has managed his loan wisely in upgrading his living condition better than before.  Now, in the group of two, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR and his co-member is applying for 1,200,000 KHR.  As the leader, his portion will be used for purchasing fertilizer and insecticide.  He hopes to gain more yield so that he can increase his income and maintain his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Santos Efraín

texts.es:
Don Santos tiene 62 años de edad, es casado y tiene siete hijos, de los cuales solo dos viven con él. Él es desmovilizado del conflicto armado, debido a eso perdió su mano derecha; pero aun así es un ejemplo en su comunidad. Él tiene experiencia en el cultivo de maíz, fríjol blanco, entre otros cultivos más. Sus padres fueron los que le enseñaron esa actividad y ha recibido asistencia de otras Instituciones técnicas para lograr mejores cosechas. Sin embargo, a sus 62 años continúa aprendiendo ya que este año cultivara sandia en compañía con otra persona que tiene mucha experiencia. 

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas tiene que viajar durante 15 kilómetros y aborda dos autobuses o pagar un vehiculo particular que es lo que normalmente hace Santos, debido a que es una comunidad bastante rustica. Le sale mejor un viaje así, para evitar llegar muy tarde a su casa, ya que las calles se encuentran en malas condiciones.
. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla, fertilizantes, foliares y para la preparación del terreno, como se trata que la siembra será de humedad, por lo que necesita que debe ararse varias veces; por lo que se gasta más en mano de obra. Con la inversión él estaría sembrando 21,000 metros cuadrados de sandia, por que comprara todos los insumos. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean unos expertos en la siembra diversificada para que sean independientes y desenvolverse mejor cada día.
texts.en:
Don Santos is 62 years old, married, and has seven children, of whom only two live with him.  He was wounded in the armed conflict, and because of that, he lost his right hand, but even so, he is still a leader in his community.  He has experience cultivating corn, white beans, as well as other crops.  His parents were the ones who taught him this business and he has received assistance from other technical organizations to achieve better harvests.  Nevertheless, at 62 years old, he continues learning since this year he will cultivate watermelon along with another person who has a lot of experience.

In order to purchase his agricultural supplies, he has to travel 15 kilometers and board two buses or pay for a ride in a private vehicle, which is what Santos usually does, since his community is quite remote.  It works better for him to travel this way, to avoid arriving home very late, since the roads are in poor condition.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides and to prepare the land, since for the sowing to maintain humidity, it is necessary to till the land several times, which means he will spend more on labor.  With this investment, he will be planting 21,000 square meters of watermelon, because he will purchase all the supplies.  His dream is that his children will be experts in diverse crops so that they will be independent and better off each day.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for the preparation of the fields.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.es:
Virgilia tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, una tiene 13 años y otra de 3 años de edad. Vive en un municipio que esta a cinco kilómetros del pueblo, se dedica a la crianza de animales como aves y cerdos, es una tradición que viene desde sus padres. Debido a que vive lejos del pueblo, ella debe viajar en autobús o en vehiculo liviano para realizar sus compras.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas, como fertilizantes y mano de obra  y para comprar cerdos para engordarlos. Con la inversión ella espera obtener una buena cosecha, para estar seguros con una parte de la alimentación de su familia y poder cancelar el crédito mas adelante. Su deseo es que sus hijos mantengan ese espíritu de trabajo y superación.
texts.en:
Virgilia, 35, is married and has two children aged 13 and 3.  She lives in a municipality five kilometers from town. She makes her living raising animals such as birds and pigs, a tradition handed down from her parents. Because she lives far from the town, she must travel by bus or light car to make her purchases. 

The loan she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, labor, and pigs to fatten. With this investment, she expects to obtain a good harvest so she can be sure to have food to feed her family and pay her loan back. Her hope is for her children to continue the spirit of work and improvement.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, labor, and pigs to fatten

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en: Amneh is a 48-year-old married woman whose husband works in the farming business to support their 6 children.  Amneh, on the other hand, has a few goats that she sells and uses for milk to make dairy products.  She now applied for this loan in order to increase the number of goats that she has to increase her profits, using the upcoming Islamic holiday tradition to distribute meat to the poor.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Teresa Agustina

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Teresa, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora, ella se dedica al comercio de productos de pasamanería para realizar manualidades como costura, bordados adornos muñecas etc. Teresa está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como cintas de colores, cintas de encaje, telas, accesorios como agujas y broches, para capitalizar su comercio. Teresa trabaja hace algún tiempo en esta su actividad, la cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio.
texts.en: This communal bank member is Señora Teresa. She belongs to the communal bank "Señor de los Temblores II" in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is a young mother of a family and is very hard-working. She sells trimmings that are used for crafts such as sewing, embroidery, decorations, dolls, etc. Teresa is applying for the loan to buy merchandise such as colored ribbons, lace trimming, fabrics, and accessories such as needles and fasteners to stock her business. Teresa has worked for some time at this business, which allows her to provide for her family, and thus she is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy colored ribbons, lace trimming, fabrics, and accessories to stock her business

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 26-year-old married man from Jarash, Jordan. 

He is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for home improvements. He would like to buy electronic appliances, such as an LCD screen. 

In the future, he hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements, namely to buy electronic appliances.

loans.name: Franco Kilderd

texts.es:
El socio es Franco, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Franco es un joven emprendedor  que  se dedica al negocio de la imprenta, principalmente lo referente a diseño de publicidad impresa. Franco está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una computadora personal para que pueda trabajar en ella sus diseños, los cuales luego plasma en la imprenta.
 Franco agradece a  KIVA por permitirle adquirir una herramienta que le ayude en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Franco is a member of the communal bank “Señor de los Temblores II” in the city of Cusco, Peru. Franco is a young entrepreneur that makes his living in the printing business, mainly in the design of print advertising. 

Franco is requesting a loan to buy a personal computer to be able to work on his designs which he then uses on the print ads. Franco is grateful to Kiva for allowing him to have this loan that will help him in his job.

loans.use: to buy a personal computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for dairy production

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is 45 years old, and is a mother of four sons. 

She operates a clothing sales business at home. She goes to different markets (generally wholesale markets) to get goods at a lower price, then she sells them to friends and neighbors. 

Maha has applied for this loan so she can add a new winter collection to her business before the holidays start, and increase her profits.

loans.use: to add a range of winter collection clothes to her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Samoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Samoeurn is 47 years old, and is married with four children. She lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Cambodia. 

To overcome the family's difficulties, she grows rice paddy on two hectares of farmland. It is the only business that she has been in for 10 years, earning about 18,000 KHR. 

Samoeurn has joined with two others, into a group of three, to apply for a new loan. She and one of her co-members are second-time borrowers, while the third member is a first-time borrower. Samoeurn is the group leader. 

She is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farming. She hopes to increase her yield and income, so she can save up some money to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farming business.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Koem is 24 years old and is a mother of one daughter. The rest of her family lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. She has been farming on two hectares of farmland and is able to earn about 19,000 KHR per day. 

Koem has never been with VisionFund before, and she is in a group of two, to apply for a new loan. Koem will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her cash-crop. She hopes to increase her income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash-crop.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 31-year-old single man from Nao'or Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for various products such as accessories, gifts, and games to resell. 

In the future, Khaled wants to expand his project by opening a shop to sell his products. He also wants to improve his family's social and economic status.

loans.use: to pay for various products to resell.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 26 year old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan, and lives with three other family members.

She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for home improvements. She would like to carry out maintenance of her home and repaint her home. She would also like to buy new furniture. She hopes to expand her home in the future.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Madleen

texts.en:
Madleen is a 41-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has requested a loan of 500 JOD to pay for opening a beauty salon inside her home and buying some needed cosmetics. 

In the future, Madleen is planning to open her own separated salon.

loans.use: to pay for opening a beauty salon inside her home.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 32-year-old married female from Al Russeifeh in Jordan. She has 2 children. 

Manal has requested a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvement expenses and to buy some furniture.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a 26-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh Jordan. She has 2 family members. 

Wafa is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and some household items. In the future, she wants to do maintenance on the home.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Majidah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Majidah prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Majidah is a 45-year-old married female from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She has 5 children. 

Majidah has requested a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvement expenses, painting, and buying some furniture.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Abd Allah

texts.en:
Abd Allah is a 20-year-old single man from Ashrafia Amman, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to buy materials for his salon, such as a skin cleaning machine. In the future, he hopes to expand his salon and to improve his family's social and economic status.
 
Since Abd Allah is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for his salon.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 37-year-old married woman who has two family members from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to buy women and children's clothes to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same of area where she would like to expand her home. 

In the future she hopes to open a shop to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a 37-year-old married woman who has five family members from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy women and children's clothes as well as cosmetic products to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same area where she wants to increase her products. 

In the future she hopes to open a shop and to buy a home and a car.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetic products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a poultry farm and buy young chickens

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Né vers 1969, Monsieur Daouda est un homme marié qui est père de 4 enfants et qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Faraba de la ville de Bougouni.
Très vite il abandonna l’école au profit des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités comme la vente des articles divers en faisant le forain, mais sans succès. Il finit par opter pour l’apprendre du métier de forgeron avec la fabrication et la vente des marmites, poêles, haches, couteaux etc.
Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse il décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son 3 eme prêt pour acheter,  500 kg aluminium et le reste de l’argent est réservé pour l’achat du bois de chauffe pour la forge. Daouda s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali)  et effectue ses ventes après fabrication de se articles dans son atelier situé au bord la route reliant Bougouni à Sikasso, à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de ménagères.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son entreprise et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Born around 1969, Daouda is married and the father of four children.  He lives with his wife and children in the Faraba neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

He left school at a young age and soon became involved in income-generating activities.  For several years he tried a wide range of activities such as selling various goods at the market, but he was not very successful.  Eventually he decided to learn how to become a blacksmith and he started to make and sell ﻿﻿pots, pans, axes, knives etc.

Having more than ten years of experience in this field, he is now a very skilled blacksmith.

In order to meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, he has decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso.  This is his third loan with the institution and he will use this loan to buy 500 kg of aluminum.  With the rest of the money, he will buy some firewood for his forge.  

Daouda buys his materials in Bamako (capital of the republic of Mali). After manufacturing his goods, he sells them in his shop, located along the road which links the cities of Sikasso and Bougouni.  Most of his customers are housewives.

He is expecting monthly profits to reach 50,000 CFA francs, which will be used to improve his business and to cover his family expenses.

loans.use: to buy aluminum.

loans.name: Wala'a

texts.en:
Wala'a is a 19-year-old single female from Al Russeifeh in Jordan. She requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for retailing in cosmetics. In the future, Wala'a is looking forward to expand her project.

Since Wala'a is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Modibo

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modibo est un homme marié de 28 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants à Bougouni dans une famille traditionnelle, dans le quartier Nièbala.
Monsieur Modibo est un jeune diplômé, qui mène depuis maintenant plus de 5 ans cette activité d’achat et de vente de tissus apprises auprès d’un de ses amis commerçant.
Nanti de plus de cinq années d’expérience dans le domaine, il maîtrise bien son activité dans laquelle il est très apprécié et sollicité à Bougouni.
Dans le cadre du renforcement de son activité commerciale, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt.et le prêt précédent a été remboursé sans difficulté. 
Il compte acheter, 15 pièces de tissus auprès des commerçants faisant le voyage du Burkina Faso. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et femmes. Il revend en détail au comptant et à crédit payable mensuellement. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000 FCFA, qui servira à rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
Modibo is a 28-year-old married man and the father of three children.  He lives with his wife and children in a traditional family in the Nièbala neighborhood of Bougouni.

Modibo holds a degree and he has been buying and selling fabrics for more than five years, an activity he learned from a friend who worked in business.

Thanks to his experience of more than five years, Modibo knows his business very well.  He is a popular seller in Bougouni and he has a large number of customers.

In order to boost his business, he has decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso.  This is his second loan with the institution, and he had no difficulty repaying his last loan.

Modibo is planning to buy 15 sets of fabrics from sellers traveling to Burkina Faso.  He sells to a retail customer base consisting of both men and women.  He sells for cash or on credit, offering the option of monthly payments.

He is expecting monthly profits to reach 45,000 CFA francs, which will be used to repay his loan and to cover his family expenses.

loans.use: to buy some fabrics.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is a 40-year-old married female from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She has 6 children and requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses, and buying some furniture. In the future, Eman is looking forward to improving her home and family living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Najah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her daughter. Najah is a 44-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan who has 4 family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy blankets to resell. She wants to increase her product to resell clothes. In the future she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy blankets to resell

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Rasha prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Rasha is a 25-year-old married female from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She has 7 children and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and for buying some electrical devices. In the future, Rasha is planning to buy some furniture and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Zanjiramo

texts.ru: Занчирамо проживает в городе Куляб. Ей 46 лет. У нее один ребенок. Муж Занчирамо государственный служащий, а ее сын учится в средней школе. Занчирамо занимается торговлей золотых изделий. В этой области она 20 лет. Торговлей она занимается у себя дома. Занчирамо берет кредит для приобретения золотых украшений.
texts.en: Zanjiramo lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 46 years old and she has one child.  Her husband is a government employee and her son is in high school.  Zanjiramo makes a living selling products made of gold.  She has been in this business for 20 years and works out of her home.  She is asking for a loan to buy gold jewelry.

loans.use: to buy gold jewelry.

loans.name: Qurbongul

texts.ru: Курбонгул жительница города Куляб. Ей 31 год. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее дети маленькие. Курбонгул работает на рынке. У нее имеется небольшая торговая точка, где она печет и продает горячую самбусу. В этой области она четыре года. Курбонгул берет кредит для приобретения стройматериалов, чтобы построить и открыть свой собственный магазин, помещение.
texts.en: Qurbongul lives in the city of Kulab.  She is 31 years old and married with two small children.  Qurboongul works at the market, where she bakes and sells hot "sambusas" from her small trading stall.  She has been in this line of work for four years.  She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials to build and open her own store.

loans.use: to buy materials to build and open her own store.

loans.name: Fakhrudin

texts.ru: Фахрудин житель города Куляб. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Фахрудин работает на рынке. У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает запчасти автомашин. Торговлей Фахрудин занимается пять лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения необходимых запчастей автомашин марки "Mercedes benz".
texts.en: Fakhrudin lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 46 years old, married and he has four children.  Farkhudin works in the market, where he sells auto parts from a trading stall.  He has been in this line of work for five years.  He is asking for a loan to buy some "Mercedes Benz" parts he needs for his shop.

loans.use: to buy necessary "Mercedes Benz" parts.

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.ru: Тахмина проживает в городе Куляб. Ей 33 года. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. Ее дети маленькие. Тахмина имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она по профессии не работает, поскольку после замужества она не смогла работать. Вот уже на протяжении семи лет Тахмина занимается шитьем. Она шьет национальные платья у себя дома. Тахмина берет кредит для приобретения новой модернизированной швейной машинки.
texts.en: Takhmina lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 33 years old, widowed, and has two small children.  Takhmina has received a higher education at the pedagogical institute.  She does not work in that profession, as she could not work after she married.  For the last seven years, Takhmina has been working as a seamstress.  She sews national costumes at her home.  Takhmina is asking for a loan to buy a newer model of sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new model of sewing machine.

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Шафоат проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж зарабатывает строительными работами по найму. Сама Шафоат занимается купле - продажей кондитерских изделий. Этим видом деятельности она занимается двенадцать лет. Шафоат берет кредит для увеличения оборота.
texts.en: Shafoat lives in the city of Khujand.  She is 45 years old and is married with two children.  Her husband is a construction worker for hire.  Shafoat herself buys and sells baked goods.  She has been in this line of work for 12 years.  She is asking for a loan so she can increase turnover.

loans.use: to buy baked goods.

loans.name: Jurakhon

texts.ru: Чурахон проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее младший сын находится в Российской Федерации, а старший вместе с ней занимается торговлей. Чурахон зарабатывает путем купле – продажи кураги. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 14 лет. Чурахон берет кредит для покупки сухофруктов.
texts.en: Jurakhon lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 48 years old and is married with two children.  Her younger son is in the Russian Federation and her older son works with her in the market.  Jurakhon buys and sells dried apricots for a living.  She has been in this line of work for 14 years.  She is asking for a loan to buy dried fruits.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit.

loans.name: Lutfillo

texts.ru:
Лутфилло предоставляет услугу. Он занимается ремонтом автомашин. В этой области Лутфилло 14 лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения оборудования (подъемник), чтобы предоставить качественную услугу. 
Лутфилло женат. Он живет с женой. Ему 48 лет. У него двое детей.
texts.en: Lutfillo provides a service repairing cars.  He has been in this line of work for 14 years.  He is asking for a loan to buy the equipment he needs to provide quality service.  Lutfillo is married and lives with his wife.  He is 48 years old and has two children.

loans.use: to buy equipment to make car repairs.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru:
Фирдавс проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Фирдавс живет с родителями. Его брат находится на заработках за рубежом. Фирдавс более шести лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном занимается купле-продажей кураги. 
Фирдавс берет кредит для приобретения других видов сухофруктов.
texts.en: Firdavs lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 26 years old, married and has one child.  Firdavs lives with his parents.  His brother works abroad.  For more than six years, Firdavs has been working in the market.  His main work is the buying and selling of dried apricots.  Firdavs is asking for a loan to buy different kinds of dried fruits.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of dried fruit.

loans.name: Nigor

texts.ru: Нигор жительница района Кумсангир. Ей 30 лет. Она живет с мужем. Нигор зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Она разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Нигор берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого и крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Nigor lives in the Qumsangir region.  She is 30 years old and she lives with her husband.  Nigor raises livestock for a living.  She works on her own farm and she has been in this line of work for three years.  She is asking for a loan to buy small and large livestock.

loans.use: to buy goats and bulls.

loans.name: Vrezh

texts.ru:
У 40 летнего Врежа двое детей: сын и дочь. Дочь учится в средней щколе, а сын - на первом курсе исторического факультета Ереванского Государственного Университета. 
Вреж работает учителем истории в Капанском колледже, а жена работает в Капанской средней щколе учительницей английского языка. Благодаря своей работе Вреж и его жена содержат семью. 
Врежу необходим кредит на сумму 150.000 драм для оплаты учебы сына в первом семестре.
texts.en: Vrezh is 40 years old and has two children: a son and a daughter.  His daughter is in high school and his son is in his first year in the history department of Yerevan State University.  Vrezh works as a history teacher at Kapan College and his wife works as a high school English teacher.  They are able to support their family because of their hard work.  Vrezh is asking for a loan of 150,000 dram to play for the first semester of his son's education.

loans.use: To pay for the first semester of his son's education.

loans.name: Muharramjon

texts.ru: Мухаррамджон женщина 57 лет, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Работает в городском центре здоровья семейным врачом. Является клиентом МДО «Арванд» с декабря 2011 года.
